Dear Mr. Gibson:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 04/21/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective
action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Tyler Armstrong, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
COF Rule 400.10113 Employee records
(1) Employee records shall be maintained for each
employee and shall include all of the following
information:
(f) A written evaluation of the employee's
performance within the first 6 months of each
position designated by these rules and annually
thereafter.
Two out of three employee files reviewed were missing evaluations within the
past year.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical assistance was provided regarding more clear signatures and
identifying which staff are completing certain forms, as well as fully completing
all paperwork at the time of completion.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• No consultation was offered during the course of this inspection.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
Yearly budgeting and expense documentation for the facility was provided by the
overseeing organization and no concerns were noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
N/A
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were completed on 04/17/2023 and 04/21/2023. Staff reported
enjoyment working for the facility in that the smaller census has allowed them to
get to know youth better and reduce the occurrences of crisis.
Youth interviews were completed on 04/17/2023 and 04/21/2023. Youth reported
that they felt well taken care of and safe at the facility. They both stated that they
were well cared for, including clothing and food. Youth stated that they felt they
were well informed of their respective cases with staff at the facility doing a good
job facilitating that communication with their families and caseworkers.
Description of Agency Walk Through

Agency walk through was completed on 04/21/2023. Cleaning supplies and food
items were in good supply and properly stored. Bedrooms for youth were clean
and free from any safety concerns.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
